name: Burton Rosenberg
content: Home Page: Burton Rosenberg John Conway, 11 April 2020 Life Game by xkcd Burton Rosenberg Associate Professor of Computer Science University of Miami Email: burt _(a)_ cs_(.)_miami_(.)_edu Office: 305-284-2141 Fax: 305-284-2264 Dept. Secretary: Christy Carrera, x-2268 Courses: CSC421/ECE421-E Computer Operating Systems MoWeFr 12:20PM—1:10PM; Mahoney Pearson 116 Witten LC 120 homepage CSC507/CSC609-G Cryptography MoWeFr 2:30–3:20; Knight Physics 108 homepage Questions? Ask in my csc-courses or csc-minicourses slack channels. All Courses/Talks QotD: The end of our foundation is the knowledge of causes, and the secret motions of things; and the enlarging of the bounds of human empire, to the effecting of all things possible. — Francis Bacon, The New Atlantis. 1626. I call him free who is led solely by reason. — Baruch Spinoza. 1632–1677. The meaning of a question is the method of answering it. Tell me how you are searching, and I will tell you what you are searching for. —Wittgenstein, Philosophical Remarks. 1975 (edited). Machines take me by surprise with great frequency. —Alan Turing , Computing Machinery and Intelligence, 1950. 2 cos (θ/2) = √ (2 + 2 cos θ) —Me, 7 December 2022 Bio: Financial cryptography; Quantum Computing; Scientific visualization. Research papers Curriculum Vitae (PDF) Projects: REU: Computing for Structure Phaser: A Web-enabled dynamical systems visualization workbench. Perl Cloudbook, for CSC 210.131. Live Cloudbook, old - to decommission learning (from 1995). the C Cloudbook Learn C: an experiment in web-based learning Ungar renovation and server room V&I Lab ePaper-Live: referencing a google-app running publicly instead of just code in the paper. How to loose with least probability Zinc@cs: various uses for the Google App Engine. Zinc is a metal, not a cloud. Artwork: April 15 Splash Random Dots Time Machine II, with Piotr Kowalski Communicationsphere with Aldo Tambellini Writings: Day of Civic Hacking: Data Visualization and Inspiration for Artistic Interpretations of Data Departmental infrastructure blog My class notes blog Departmental computer information Notes from hacking the NT Kernel Notes on cryptography Preface to Undergraduate thesis written at the MIT Visible Language Workshop. A theory of harmonic intervals (music) Fingering charts for piano old nwsa ptsa site Links: Locust Projects Miami Light Project Fountain Art Fair Pulse Art Fair Math/CS on the web since 1994. old homepage (1996) Calculators I have loved IBM 1130, my first computer; wrote Hunt the Wumpus with interrupt routine. music from data information is beautiful Pulse art fair UM CSC Alum Matt Mankins in United Airlines magazine who packed my eggs? and when?
